title: Undead Type Profile Template
description: Defines a type of undead -- beings once alive that now exist between life and death. Only create original undead if substantially different from existing types. Goals and behavior patterns are what truly distinguish one undead type from another.

id.description: Unique identifier for this undead type (auto-generated)

type.description: Classification: spiritual (no body), corporeal with soul, or corporeal without soul

based_on.description: What type of being this undead was in life

mind.description: Whether the mind goes with the soul affects mental capability

origin_method.description: How this type of undead is created

origin_details.description: What specific event/phenomenon/spell/technology creates this undead

creator_if_designed.description: If created by design: who, why, do they control it

prerequisites.description: Conditions that must be met before something becomes this undead (burial method, life circumstances, death type)

prevention_methods.description: How to prevent this type of undead from forming -- these become cultural burial customs

time_dead_before_transformation.description: How long dead before transformation occurs

killing_original_effect.description: Does killing the original affect those it created?

goals.description: Primary goals (unfinished business, regain life, find peace, torment others)

behavior_pattern.description: The typical behavior pattern that identifies this type -- this is what makes it distinctive

touch_effects.description: Can it touch physical world? Does touch corrupt or cause visions?

movement.description: Slow, fast, teleporting, passes through objects

location_type.description: Grave, home, death site, ship, etc.

between_activity.description: Where does it go when not active

residence.description: Where it resides and whether it is bound to a location

solitary_or_pack.description: Found alone, in groups, or both? If a pack, can they communicate and move as if sharing a mind?

prey.description: Does it prey on anyone in particular? The innocent? Those of a certain religion? What does it do to victims -- turn them, feed parasitically, or just kill?

places_found.description: Specific places this undead is found -- kingdoms, cities, forests, graveyards

destruction_method.description: How to permanently destroy this undead

what_harms_it.description: What can harm but not destroy it

can_return_after_destruction.description: Can it return after destruction? Under what conditions?

combat.description: How it fights (physical, supernatural, psychological), special attacks

cultural_burial_customs_inspired.description: Burial customs and cultural practices that exist because of this undead type

species_reactions.description: How different species react to this undead type

places_found.description: Specific places or regions where this undead type is found

solitary_or_pack.description: Whether this undead type is found alone or in groups

characteristics_and_skills.description: Physical and mental characteristics and special skills

prey.description: What this undead type hunts or feeds on

x-cross-references.god-profile: Gods may have created or cursed beings into undead
x-cross-references.afterlife-design: The afterlife concept affects undead behavior and goals
x-cross-references.religion-profile: Religions develop customs around preventing undead
x-cross-references.species-profile: Species develop burial customs because of undead types
x-cross-references.culture-profile: Cultural practices around death may be influenced by undead
